Struggle of Government Employees Union Supported in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils reportedly made public a statement on Wednesday and stressed that it would positively support and solidarize with the Government Employees Union in its struggle for the three rights of labor.
 The statement said that the government seized and searched the branch office rooms of the union in all areas from November 6 to crack down on the vote for and against the general strike of the union and walked away at least 190 unionists who participated in the rally to vow to struggle for the three rights of labor on November 7.    
 The government's crackdown is little different from the suppression of trade unions during the military dictatorial "government", said the statement.

articles.content:
U.S. Moves for Nuclear War against DPRK under Fire 
    Pyongyang, November 13 (KCNA) -- No matter what others may say the DPRK will as ever strive to increase its self-defensive nuclear deterrent force to cope with the U.S. moves for a nuclear war for the sake of the country and the nation, declared a spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland in a statement issued on Nov. 12.
 Recalling that the United States worked out a scenario for using 30 nuclear bombs in the northern area of Korea in case of emergency on the Korean Peninsula and staged even an exercise of dropping sham nuclear warheads, the statement termed this a serious violation of peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and an unpardonable criminal move to bring the Korean nation a horrible nuclear disaster.    
 The statement continued: The U.S. has been loudmouthed about a "peaceful settlement" of the DPRK-U.S. nuclear issue and the six-party talks but it has become clearer that it is only watching for an opportunity after completing its preparations for a nuclear war to stifle the DPRK. The situation firmly convinces the Korean people that what the DPRK has done to build a powerful nuclear deterrent force to cope with the U.S. moves for a nuclear war was a just measure to protect the security of the country and the nation.
